tool.name: ete3 manipulate tree topology by rooting, pruning or sorting branches
tool.command: ete3 mod '$src_tree_list' '$input_tree' -v '$verbosity' #if str($outgroup) != '': --outgroup $outgroup #end if ## #if float($ultrametric) > 0.0: ## --ultrametric $ultrametric ## #end if #if str($prune) != '': --prune $prune #end if $prune_preserve_lengths $unroot $sort_branches $ladderize $resolve_polytomies $standardize > $output_tree

param.name: outgroup
param.label: Reroot tree with outgroup (space separated list of leaf names)
param.help: Root the tree using the provided outgroup. If several names are provided, the first common ancestor grouping all of them will be selected as outgroup

param.name: prune
param.label: Prune nodes from the tree (space separated list of leaf names)
param.help: Remove all nodes in the tree except the ones provided (empty does not prune)

param.name: prune_preserve_lengths
param.label: Prune: preserve length
param.help: branch lengths of the removed nodes are added to the kept branches, thus preserving original tree length (--prune_preserve_lengths)

param.name: sort_branches
param.label: Sort branches
param.help: Sort branches according to node names (--sort_branches)

param.name: standardize
param.label: Standardize tree
param.help: Standardize tree topology by expanding polytomies and single child nodes (--standardize)

tool.help:
usage: ete3 mod [-h] [-t [SRC_TREES [SRC_TREES ...]]] [--src_tree_list SRC_TREE_LIST] [--src_tree_attr SRC_TREE_ATTR] [--src_attr_parser SRC_ATTR_PARSER] [--src_tree_format SRC_NEWICK_FORMAT] [-o OUTPUT] [-v {0,1,2,3,4}] [--outgroup OUTGROUP [OUTGROUP ...]] [--ultrametric [ULTRAMETRIC [ULTRAMETRIC ...]]] [--prune PRUNE [PRUNE ...]] [--prune_preserve_lengths] [--unroot] [--sort_branches] [--ladderize] [--resolve_polytomies] [--standardize]
SOURCE TREES -t [SRC_TREES [SRC_TREES ...]] a list of trees in newick format (filenames or quoted strings) --src_tree_list SRC_TREE_LIST path to a file containing many source trees, one per line --src_tree_attr SRC_TREE_ATTR attribute in source tree used as leaf name --src_attr_parser SRC_ATTR_PARSER Perl regular expression wrapping the portion of the target attribute that should be used. --src_tree_format SRC_NEWICK_FORMAT
GENERAL OPTIONS -v {0,1,2,3,4} Verbosity level: 0=totally quite, 1=errors only, 2=warning+errors, 3=info+warnings+errors 4=debug
TREE EDIT OPTIONS --outgroup OUTGROUP [OUTGROUP ...] Root the tree using the provided outgroup. If several names are provided, the first common ancestor grouping all of them will be selected as outgroup. --ultrametric [ULTRAMETRIC [ULTRAMETRIC ...]] Convert tree into ultrametric (all leaves have the same distance to root). If an argument is provided, it will be used as the expected tree length. --prune PRUNE [PRUNE ...] Remove all nodes in the tree except the ones provided. --prune_preserve_lengths branch lengths of the removed nodes are added to the kept branches, thus preserving original tree length. --unroot Unroots the tree. --sort_branches Sort branches according to node names. --ladderize Sort branches by partition size. --resolve_polytomies Converts polytomies into random bifurcations --standardize Standardize tree topology by expanding polytomies and single child nodes.
